title: Method for chemical-mechanical planarization of a substrate on a fixed-abrasive polishing pad

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Tungsten (W) using a silica-ceria fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free potassium iodate (KI) planarizing solution at pH 4.5. Based on specific example in text.

process_characteristics.description: Characteristics of the CMP process and resulting surface.
process_characteristics.surface_modification: Forms non-soluble oxides / scabrous layer on substrate surface.
process_characteristics.defect_reduction: Aimed at reducing defects compared to dry fixed-abrasive polishing.

cmp_conditions_and_outcome.polishing_process: Substrate pressed against pad with relative motion.
cmp_conditions_and_outcome.expected_outcome: Increased polishing rate; Planar surface without etching.
cmp_conditions_and_outcome.material_removal_mechanism: Mechanical removal of chemically modified (oxidized/scabrous) layer by fixed abrasives.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Tungsten (W) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution with an oxidant (e.g., Ferric Nitrate, Hydrogen Peroxide, Potassium Iodate, Bromine) at pH 4.0-5.0. Based on claims 2, 7, 13, 16, 17, 18, 23, 24, 25, 26, 33, 37.

additives.name: Ferric Nitrate / Hydrogen Peroxide / Potassium Iodate / Bromine

process_characteristics.description: Characteristics of the CMP process and resulting surface.
process_characteristics.surface_modification: Forms non-soluble oxides / scabrous layer on substrate surface.
process_characteristics.defect_reduction: Aimed at reducing defects compared to dry fixed-abrasive polishing.

cmp_conditions_and_outcome.polishing_process: Substrate pressed against pad with relative motion.
cmp_conditions_and_outcome.expected_outcome: Increased polishing rate; Planar surface without etching.
cmp_conditions_and_outcome.material_removal_mechanism: Mechanical removal of chemically modified (oxidized/scabrous) layer by fixed abrasives.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Copper (Cu) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution with an oxidant at pH < 2.5 or > 10.5. Based on claim 3.

process_characteristics.description: Characteristics of the CMP process and resulting surface.
process_characteristics.surface_modification: Forms non-soluble oxides / scabrous layer on substrate surface.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Copper (Cu) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution containing Nitric Acid (0.1-5.0%) and Ethanol (0.1-10.0%) at pH < 2.5 or > 10.5. Based on text example.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Copper (Cu) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution containing Nitric Acid (0.1-5.0%) and Benzotriazole (BTA, 0.1-1.0%) at pH < 2.5 or > 10.5. Based on text example.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of Aluminum (Al) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution with an oxidant (e.g., Hydrogen Peroxide, Potassium Iodate, Ferric Nitrate) at pH 3.0-10.0. Based on claims 4, 8, 14, 19, 20, 21, 27, 28, 34, 38.

samples.experiment_context: General method for planarizing a metal surface using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and an abrasive-free planarizing solution with a chemical oxidant at pH <= 5.0. Based on claims 1, 6, 12.

samples.experiment_context: Planarization of a chalcogenide material (which forms a native oxide) using a fixed-abrasive polishing pad and a liquid that does not dissolve the chalcogenide. Based on text description.

planarizing_solution.description: Planarizing solution details (may or may not contain added oxidant).

target.description: pH controlled to not dissolve chalcogenide material

process_characteristics.description: Characteristics of the CMP process and resulting surface.
process_characteristics.defect_reduction: Aimed at reducing defects compared to dry fixed-abrasive polishing.

cmp_conditions_and_outcome.polishing_process: Substrate pressed against pad with relative motion.
cmp_conditions_and_outcome.material_removal_mechanism: Mechanical removal of native oxide layer by fixed abrasives.
